Package com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview

Class SmartGraphEdgeLine<E,V>

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.shape.Shape
javafx.scene.shape.Line
com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview.SmartGraphEdgeLine<E,V>
Type Parameters:
E - Type stored in the underlying edge
V - Type of connecting vertex
All Implemented Interfaces:
SmartGraphEdge<E,V>, SmartGraphEdgeBase<E,V>, SmartLabelledNode, SmartStylableNode, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class SmartGraphEdgeLine<E,V> extends javafx.scene.shape.Line implements SmartGraphEdgeBase<E,V>
Implementation of a straight line edge.
Author:
brunomnsilva

  • Method Details

    • setStyleInline

      public void setStyleInline(String css)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies cumulatively the css inline styles to the node.
      These inline JavaFX styles have higher priority and are not overwritten by any css classes set by SmartStylableNode.addStyleClass(java.lang.String). But will be discarded if you use SmartStylableNode.setStyleClass(java.lang.String)
      If you need to clear any previously set inline styles, use .setStyleInline(null). Not that this will clear all inline styles previously applied.
      Specified by:
      setStyleInline in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      css - styles

    • setStyleClass

      public void setStyleClass(String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.
      The cssClass string must not contain a preceding dot, e.g., "myClass" instead of ".myClass".
      The CSS Class must be defined in smartgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.
      The expected behavior is to remove all current styling before applying the class css.
      Specified by:
      setStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • addStyleClass

      public void addStyleClass(String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies cumulatively the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.
      The CSS Class must be defined in smartgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.
      The cumulative operation will overwrite any existing styling elements previously defined for previous classes.
      Specified by:
      addStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • removeStyleClass

      public boolean removeStyleClass(String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Removes a previously cssClass existing CSS styling.
      Given styles can be added sequentially, the removal of a css class will be a removal that keeps the previous ordering of kept styles.
      Specified by:
      removeStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.
      Returns:
      true if successful; false if cssClass wasn't previously set.
